title: Mandatory consent classes will only turn young men off from being good feminists
text:
When I was at university, I encountered all sorts of men. Most were nice, some were dreadful bores, others vile snobs, a handful were lovely and handsome, and a sprinkling were downright nasty. I gave those ones a wide berth (usually) and, despite several bruising relationships, basically left university intact in all the important ways. Nobody came close to laying an unwanted hand on me; nobody was coercive or threatening.

Sadly, many women are not nearly so lucky. Reports of sexual violence at British universities have risen by 82 per cent in the past year. Universities clearly enable some of the very worst strains of laddish masculinity, with women paying a stark price.

What to do? Anything,...
